pageContext.claim: “I say that we would cut our crime -- you know, we're very well on crime rate, compared to past years and past administration, but I think our crime rate would go way down.”
pageContext.analysis: On average, both violent and non-violent crime has been declining for the last thirty years — well before Trump considered politics. Plus, the president regularly suggests that building the wall would push crime rates down further, but there's little evidence to support this assertion. Most independent research contradicts the idea the immigrants (documented or undocumented) bring increased crime.
